title: What's the name of the person who does chemistry? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your question is grammatically incorrect. It should be “What’s the name of a person who does chemistry?” Unless, of course, you are under the impression that only one individual does chemistry, which is false— there are many chemists in the world. And I suppose that also answers the question: one who does chemistry is a chemist.

A person who has studied chemistry and is working in a chemistry-related job is usually called a chemist. However, at least in the UK and some other countries, a ‘chemist’ can also be a person in charge of a pharmacy. By extension, a pharmacy is also called (in the UK) a chemist (as in “I’m going to the chemist”). See: What is the difference between a druggist, a pharmacist, and a chemist?
